temperament_observations: Daily routines: Morning dressing is a daily struggle involving tantrums

concerns.parent_narrative: קושי עצום עם מעברים, כל יום זה מאבק ענק. Specific difficulty with getting dressed in the morning. He refuses to stop playing and goes into a tantrum when the parent tries to dress him. This happens every day. Reiterates that every morning is the same struggle

hypotheses.theory: Transition struggles might be related to difficulty shifting attention (cognitive flexibility) rather than the destination task itself
hypotheses.source_details: Pattern of tantrums specifically when asked to stop playing
questions_to_explore: Does he have trouble stopping play for other things (eating, bath)?
Is the issue stopping the play, or the dressing itself (sensory)?

evidence.content: He isn't willing to stop playing

patterns.description: Observations: קושי עצום עם מעברים; מאבק ענק בבוקר

patterns.theme: Transitions from preferred activities trigger dysregulation
patterns.description: Observations: Previous: difficulty with transitions; Current: refuses to stop playing for dressing; Current: tantrums when interrupted

pending_insights.content: Wants help understanding the situation better; looking for a way to overcome difficulty remembering details

journal_entries.content: בעיקר ההתלבשות בבוקר. הוא לא מוכן להפסיק לשחק, ואז כשאני צריכה להלביש אותו הוא נכנס להתקף זעם. זה קורה כל יום
journal_entries.context: Parent describing the specific morning difficulty
